name: Deep blue
description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

key_work.title: The Blue Planet
key_work.creator_credit: Alastair Fothergill and BBC Television Centre
key_work.brief_description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

constellations_primary.name: Deep blue
constellations_primary.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

start.title: Baltique Sea Plastique
start.brief_description: The Baltic Sea Plastique installation sets out to explore the complexity and controversial nature of the environmental threat caused by plastic waste.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.title: The Blue Planet
end.creator_credit: Alastair Fothergill and BBC Television Centre
end.brief_description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

constellations_primary.name: Deep blue
constellations_primary.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: Both Närhinen’s work and David Attenborough’s documentary warn of the dangers to marine life from waste plastics.

start.title: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
start.creator_credit: Barry Mendel, Dan Beers, Scott Rudin, Wes Anderson and Scott Rudin Productions
start.brief_description: Renowned oceanographer Steve Zissou has sworn vengeance upon the rare shark that devoured a member of his crew. He and his crew travel the sea, all too often running into pirates and, perhaps more traumatically, various figures from Zissou’s past, including his estranged wife, Eleanor.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

constellations_other.name: Enter the dollhouse
constellations_other.description: From cottagecore inspired videogames to unsettling props, explore how dollhouses have been used and represented across screen culture.

end.title: Deepsea Challenge
end.brief_description: Described as being a film about determination, danger and the ocean’s greatest depths, James Cameron’s “Deepsea Challenge 3D” tells the story of Cameron’s journey to fulfill his boyhood dream of becoming an explorer.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: Like Steve Zissou using a submarine to track down the elusive Jaguar Shark, James Cameron ventured by sub to the Mariana Trench to capture previously unseen marine life on film.

start.title: Deepsea Challenge
start.brief_description: Described as being a film about determination, danger and the ocean’s greatest depths, James Cameron’s “Deepsea Challenge 3D” tells the story of Cameron’s journey to fulfill his boyhood dream of becoming an explorer.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.title: Baltique Sea Plastique
end.brief_description: The Baltic Sea Plastique installation sets out to explore the complexity and controversial nature of the environmental threat caused by plastic waste.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: Echoing the captivating translucence that Cameron discovered in many of the deepest sea creatures, Tuula Närhinen’s work uses plastic recovered from the ocean to mimic these otherworldly forms of life.

start.title: Paysages du Silence (Silent Landscapes)
start.brief_description: Made in 1947, SILENT LANDSCAPES / PAYSAGES DU SILENCE is one of the earliest films made by Jacques Cousteau. The film was shot at a depth of up to 60 meters depth in the Mediterranean sea. This version is entirely silent, but the theatrical release version has an accompanying soundtrack.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.creator_credit: Barry Mendel, Dan Beers, Scott Rudin, Wes Anderson and Scott Rudin Productions
end.brief_description: Renowned oceanographer Steve Zissou has sworn vengeance upon the rare shark that devoured a member of his crew. He and his crew travel the sea, all too often running into pirates and, perhaps more traumatically, various figures from Zissou’s past, including his estranged wife, Eleanor.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

constellations_other.name: Enter the dollhouse
constellations_other.description: From cottagecore inspired videogames to unsettling props, explore how dollhouses have been used and represented across screen culture.

links.description: In Wes Anderson’s The Life Aquatic, Bill Murray plays Steve Zissou, a documentarian modeled after Jacques Cousteau.

start.title: The Blue Planet
start.creator_credit: Alastair Fothergill and BBC Television Centre
start.brief_description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

constellations_primary.name: Deep blue
constellations_primary.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.title: ABZÛ
end.brief_description: ABZÛ is an exploration game where you are a lone diver in a lush ocean world. The diver descends deeper and deeper into the depths, where she will encounter majestic creatures, discover ancient secrets, and search for her true purpose.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: The Blue Planet explores the majesty, and fragility of ocean life. In ABZU, you play as a diver in a vast oceanic world interacting with marine animals to restore life to the planet.

start.title: ABZÛ
start.brief_description: ABZÛ is an exploration game where you are a lone diver in a lush ocean world. The diver descends deeper and deeper into the depths, where she will encounter majestic creatures, discover ancient secrets, and search for her true purpose.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.title: Paysages du Silence (Silent Landscapes)
end.brief_description: Made in 1947, SILENT LANDSCAPES / PAYSAGES DU SILENCE is one of the earliest films made by Jacques Cousteau. The film was shot at a depth of up to 60 meters depth in the Mediterranean sea. This version is entirely silent, but the theatrical release version has an accompanying soundtrack.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: ABZU‘s main character is a diver but the most iconic diver would have to be Jacques Cousteau, who along with filming some of the earliest marine documentaries, also helped to advance and design diving equipment.

start.title: The Blue Planet
start.creator_credit: Alastair Fothergill and BBC Television Centre
start.brief_description: David Attenborough narrates a natural history of the oceans.

constellations_primary.name: Deep blue
constellations_primary.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

end.title: Eye of fire
end.brief_description: A gas leak in an underwater pipeline caused an oceanic fireball dubbed ‘The Eye of Fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico. The state owned company is investigating the causes.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

links.description: The fragility of the ocean was apparent when it literally caught fire after a gas leak. Films like The Blue Planet communicate the negative environmental impact of humans on the ocean, but fossil fuel companies don’t seem to have watched any.
